branch_protection_rule$created.description: Activity related to a branch protection rule. For more information, see "[About branch protection rules](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-rules)."
branch_protection_rule$created.title: branch protection rule created event

branch_protection_rule$deleted.description: Activity related to a branch protection rule. For more information, see "[About branch protection rules](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-rules)."
branch_protection_rule$deleted.title: branch protection rule deleted event

branch_protection_rule$edited.description: Activity related to a branch protection rule. For more information, see "[About branch protection rules](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-rules)."

changes.description: If the action was `edited`, the changes to the rule.

branch_protection_rule$edited.title: branch protection rule edited event

head_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that is being checked.

status.description: The current status of the check run. Can be `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

conclusion.description: The result of the completed check run. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has completed.

started_at.description: The time that the check run began. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

completed_at.description: The time the check completed. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

name.description: The name of the check run.

id.description: The id of the check suite that this check run is part of.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that is being checked.

pull_requests.description:
An array of pull requests that match this check suite. A pull request matches a check suite if they have the same `head_branch`.  
  
**Note:**

*   The `head_sha` of the check suite can differ from the `sha` of the pull request if subsequent pushes are made into the PR.
*   When the check suite's `head_branch` is in a forked repository it will be `null` and the `pull_requests` array will be empty.

requested_action.description: The action requested by the user.

identifier.description: The integrator reference of the action requested by the user.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that is being checked.

status.description: The current status of the check run. Can be `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

conclusion.description: The result of the completed check run. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has completed.

completed_at.description: The time the check completed. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

id.description: The id of the check suite that this check run is part of.

*   When the check suite's `head_branch` is in a forked repository it will be `null` and the `pull_requests` array will be empty.

requested_action.description: The action requested by the user.

identifier.description: The integrator reference of the action requested by the user.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that is being checked.

status.description: The phase of the lifecycle that the check is currently in.

conclusion.description: The result of the completed check run. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has `completed`.

started_at.description: The time that the check run began. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

completed_at.description: The time the check completed. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

id.description: The id of the check suite that this check run is part of.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that is being checked.

pull_requests.description:
An array of pull requests that match this check suite. A pull request matches a check suite if they have the same `head_branch`.  
  
**Note:**

*   The `head_sha` of the check suite can differ from the `sha` of the pull request if subsequent pushes are made into the PR.
*   When the check suite's `head_branch` is in a forked repository it will be `null` and the `pull_requests` array will be empty.

requested_action.description: The action requested by the user.

identifier.description: The integrator reference of the action requested by the user.

head_branch.description: The head branch name the changes are on.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that is being checked.

status.description: The summary status for all check runs that are part of the check suite. Can be `queued`, `requested`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

conclusion.description: The summary conclusion for all check runs that are part of the check suite. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has `completed`.

url.description: URL that points to the check suite API resource.

pull_requests.description: An array of pull requests that match this check suite. A pull request matches a check suite if they have the same `head_sha` and `head_branch`. When the check suite's `head_branch` is in a forked repository it will be `null` and the `pull_requests` array will be empty.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that is being checked.

conclusion.description: The summary conclusion for all check runs that are part of the check suite. Can be one of `success`, `failure`,` neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has completed.

alert.description: The code scanning alert involved in the event.

created_at.description: The time that the alert was created in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.`

url.description: The REST API URL of the alert resource.

html_url.description: The GitHub URL of the alert resource.

state.description: State of a code scanning alert.

dismissed_at.description: The time that the alert was dismissed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

dismissed_reason.description: The reason for dismissing or closing the alert. Can be one of: `false positive`, `won't fix`, and `used in tests`.

id.description: A unique identifier for the rule used to detect the alert.

description.description: A short description of the rule used to detect the alert.

name.description: The name of the tool used to generate the code scanning analysis alert.

version.description: The version of the tool used to detect the alert.

ref.description: The Git reference of the code scanning alert. When the action is `reopened_by_user` or `closed_by_user`, the event was triggered by the `sender` and this value will be empty.

commit_oid.description: The commit SHA of the code scanning alert. When the action is `reopened_by_user` or `closed_by_user`, the event was triggered by the `sender` and this value will be empty.

commit_comment$created.description: A commit comment is created. The type of activity is specified in the `action` property.

id.description: The ID of the commit comment.

node_id.description: The node ID of the commit comment.

position.description: The line index in the diff to which the comment applies.

line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

path.description: The relative path of the file to which the comment applies.

commit_id.description: The SHA of the commit to which the comment applies.

commit_comment$created.title: commit_comment created event

create$event.description: A Git branch or tag is created.

ref_type.description: The type of Git ref object created in the repository. Can be either `branch` or `tag`.

master_branch.description: The name of the repository's default branch (usually `main`).

pusher_type.description: The pusher type for the event. Can be either `user` or a deploy key.

create$event.title: create event

property_name.description: The name of the property that was deleted.

new_property_values.description: The new custom property values for the repository.

old_property_values.description: The old custom property values for the repository.

delete$event.description: A Git branch or tag is deleted.

ref_type.description: The type of Git ref object deleted in the repository. Can be either `branch` or `tag`.

pusher_type.description: The pusher type for the event. Can be either `user` or a deploy key.

delete$event.title: delete event

environment.description: The name of the environment that has the deployment protection rule.

event.description: The event that triggered the deployment protection rule.

deployment_callback_url.description: The URL to review the deployment protection rule.

state.description: The new state. Can be `pending`, `success`, `failure`, or `error`.

description.description: The optional human-readable description added to the status.

target_url.description: The optional link added to the status.

name.description: The name of the check run.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that is being checked.

status.description: The current status of the check run. Can be `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

conclusion.description: The result of the completed check run. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has completed.

body.description: The main text of the comment.
The main text of the comment.
The main text of the comment.

gollum$event.description: A wiki page is created or updated.

action.description: The action that was performed on the page. Can be `created` or `edited`.

sha.description: The latest commit SHA of the page.

html_url.description: Points to the HTML wiki page.

gollum$event.title: gollum event

repositories_removed.description: An array of repository objects, which were removed from the installation.

installation_target$renamed.title: installation_target renamed event
installation_target$renamed.description: Somebody renamed the user or organization account that a GitHub App is installed on.

state.description: State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'
State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'

from.description: The previous version of the body.

state.description: State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'

issues$assigned.description: Activity related to an issue. The type of activity is specified in the action property.

assignee.description: The optional user who was assigned or unassigned from the issue.

issues$assigned.title: issues assigned event

from.description: The previous version of the body.
The previous version of the title.

label.description: The label that was added to the issue.

assignee.description: The optional user who was assigned or unassigned from the issue.

label.description: The label that was removed from the issue.

changes.description: The changes to the label if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The previous version of the color if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the name if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the description if the action was `edited`.

member$added.description: Activity related to repository collaborators. The type of activity is specified in the action property.
member$added.title: member added event

member.description: The user who's permissions are changed.

changes.description: The changes to the collaborator permissions

from.description: The previous permissions of the collaborator if the action was edited.

scope.description: The scope of the membership. Currently, can only be `team`.

member.description: The [user](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/users) that was added or removed.

scope.description: The scope of the membership. Currently, can only be `team`.

member.description: The [user](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/users) that was added or removed.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the merge group.

head_ref.description: The full ref of the merge group.

base_ref.description: The full ref of the branch the merge group will be merged into.

base_sha.description: The SHA of the merge group's parent commit.

head_commit.description: An expanded representation of the `head_sha` commit.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the merge group.

head_ref.description: The full ref of the merge group.

base_ref.description: The full ref of the branch the merge group will be merged into.

base_sha.description: The SHA of the merge group's parent commit.

head_commit.description: An expanded representation of the `head_sha` commit.

hook_id.description: The id of the modified webhook.

hook.description: The modified webhook. This will contain different keys based on the type of webhook it is: repository, organization, business, app, or GitHub Marketplace.

content_type.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include `json` and `form`. The default is `form`.

secret.description: If provided, the `secret` will be used as the `key` to generate the HMAC hex digest value for [delivery signature headers](https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers).

url.description: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

insecure_ssl.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for `url` will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include `0` (verification is performed) and `1` (verification is not performed). The default is `0`.

changes.description: The changes to the milestone if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The previous version of the description if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the due date if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the title if the action was `edited`.

blocked_user.description: Information about the user that was blocked or unblocked.
Information about the user that was blocked or unblocked.

invitation.description: The invitation for the user or email if the action is `member_invited`.

package_type.description: The type of supported package. Packages in GitHub's Gradle registry have the type `maven`. Docker images pushed to GitHub's Container registry (`ghcr.io`) have the type `container`. You can use the type `docker` to find images that were pushed to GitHub's Docker registry (`docker.pkg.github.com`), even if these have now been migrated to the Container registry.

package_version.description: A version of a software package

id.description: Unique identifier of the package version.

name.description: The name of the package version.

package_version.description: A version of a software package

id.description: Unique identifier of the package version.

name.description: The name of the package version.

hook_id.description: The ID of the webhook that triggered the ping.

app_id.description: When you register a new GitHub App, GitHub sends a ping event to the **webhook URL** you specified during registration. The event contains the `app_id`, which is required for [authenticating](https://docs.github.com/en/apps/building-integrations/setting-up-and-registering-github-apps/about-authentication-options-for-github-apps) an app.

content_type.description: The media type used to serialize the payloads. Supported values include `json` and `form`. The default is `form`.

secret.description: If provided, the `secret` will be used as the `key` to generate the HMAC hex digest value for [delivery signature headers](https://docs.github.com/webhooks/event-payloads/#delivery-headers).

url.description: The URL to which the payloads will be delivered.

insecure_ssl.description: Determines whether the SSL certificate of the host for `url` will be verified when delivering payloads. Supported values include `0` (verification is performed) and `1` (verification is not performed). The default is `0`.

changes.description: The changes to the project if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The changes to the project if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the body if the action was `edited`.

public$event.description: When a private repository is made public.
public$event.title: public event

state.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

reason.description: The reason the pull request was removed from a merge queue.

changes.description: The changes to the comment if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The previous version of the body if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the title if the action was `edited`.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

from.description: The previous version of the body if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the body.

ref.description: The full git ref that was pushed. Example: `refs/heads/main` or `refs/tags/v3.14.1`.

before.description: The SHA of the most recent commit on `ref` before the push.

after.description: The SHA of the most recent commit on `ref` after the push.

forced.description: Whether this push was a force push of the `ref`.

compare.description: URL that shows the changes in this `ref` update, from the `before` commit to the `after` commit. For a newly created `ref` that is directly based on the default branch, this is the comparison between the head of the default branch and the `after` commit. Otherwise, this shows all commits until the `after` commit.

commits.description: An array of commit objects describing the pushed commits. (Pushed commits are all commits that are included in the `compare` between the `before` commit and the `after` commit.) The array includes a maximum of 20 commits. If necessary, you can use the [Commits API](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#commits) to fetch additional commits. This limit is applied to timeline events only and isn't applied to webhook deliveries.

head_commit.description: For pushes where `after` is or points to a commit object, an expanded representation of that commit. For pushes where `after` refers to an annotated tag object, an expanded representation of the commit pointed to by the annotated tag.

package_type.description: The type of supported package. Packages in GitHub's Gradle registry have the type `maven`. Docker images pushed to GitHub's Container registry (`ghcr.io`) have the type `container`. You can use the type `docker` to find images that were pushed to GitHub's Docker registry (`docker.pkg.github.com`), even if these have now been migrated to the Container registry.

package_version.description: A version of a software package

id.description: Unique identifier of the package version.

name.description: The name of the package version.

package_type.description: The type of supported package. Packages in GitHub's Gradle registry have the type `maven`. Docker images pushed to GitHub's Container registry (`ghcr.io`) have the type `container`. You can use the type `docker` to find images that were pushed to GitHub's Docker registry (`docker.pkg.github.com`), even if these have now been migrated to the Container registry.

package_version.description: A version of a software package

id.description: Unique identifier of the package version.

name.description: The name of the package version.

from.description: The previous version of the body if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the name if the action was `edited`.

prerelease.description: Whether the release is identified as a prerelease or a full release.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.
Whether the repository is private or public.

alert.description: The secret scanning alert involved in the event.

security_advisory.description: The details of the security advisory, including summary, description, and severity.
The details of the security advisory, including summary, description, and severity.
The details of the security advisory, including summary, description, and severity.
The details of the security advisory, including summary, description, and severity.

from.description: The `edited` event types include the details about the change when someone edits a sponsorship to change the privacy.

effective_date.description: The `pending_cancellation` and `pending_tier_change` event types will include the date the cancellation or tier change will take effect.
The `pending_cancellation` and `pending_tier_change` event types will include the date the cancellation or tier change will take effect.

starred_at.description: The time the star was created. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Will be `null` for the `deleted` action.
The time the star was created. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Will be `null` for the `deleted` action.

id.description: The unique identifier of the status.

target_url.description: The optional link added to the status.

description.description: The optional human-readable description added to the status.

state.description: The new state. Can be `pending`, `success`, `failure`, or `error`.

branches.description: An array of branch objects containing the status' SHA. Each branch contains the given SHA, but the SHA may or may not be the head of the branch. The array includes a maximum of 10 branches.

changes.description: The changes to the team if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The previous version of the description if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the name if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the team's privacy if the action was `edited`.

admin.description: The previous version of the team member's `admin` permission on a repository, if the action was `edited`.

pull.description: The previous version of the team member's `pull` permission on a repository, if the action was `edited`.

push.description: The previous version of the team member's `push` permission on a repository, if the action was `edited`.

inputs.description: Inputs to the workflow. Each key represents the name of the input while it's value represents the value of that input.

ref.description: The branch ref from which the workflow was run.

workflow.description: Relative path to the workflow file which contains the workflow.

ref.description: The full Git reference, formatted as `refs/heads/<branch name>`.

analysis_key.description: Identifies the configuration under which the analysis was executed. For example, in GitHub Actions this includes the workflow filename and job name.

environment.description: Identifies the variable values associated with the environment in which the analysis that generated this alert instance was performed, such as the language that was analyzed.

state.description: State of a code scanning alert.

app.description: GitHub apps are a new way to extend GitHub. They can be installed directly on organizations and user accounts and granted access to specific repositories. They come with granular permissions and built-in webhooks. GitHub apps are first class actors within GitHub.

id.description: Unique identifier of the GitHub app

slug.description: The slug name of the GitHub app

name.description: The name of the GitHub app

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the GitHub app

events.description: The list of events for the GitHub app

app.title: App

author_association.description: How the author is associated with the repository.
author_association.title: AuthorAssociation

commit_title.description: Title for the merge commit message.

commit_message.description: Commit message for the merge commit.

auto-merge.title: PullRequestAutoMerge
auto-merge.description: The status of auto merging a pull request.

branch-protection-rule.description: The branch protection rule. Includes a `name` and all the [branch protection settings](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-settings) applied to branches that match the name. Binary settings are boolean. Multi-level configurations are one of `off`, `non_admins`, or `everyone`. Actor and build lists are arrays of strings.
branch-protection-rule.title: branch protection rule

check-run-deployment.description: A deployment to a repository environment. This will only be populated if the check run was created by a GitHub Actions workflow job that references an environment.
check-run-deployment.title: Check Run Deployment

distinct.description: Whether this commit is distinct from any that have been pushed before.

timestamp.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp of the commit.

url.description: URL that points to the commit API resource.

added.description: An array of files added in the commit. For extremely large commits where GitHub is unable to calculate this list in a timely manner, this may be empty even if files were added.

modified.description: An array of files modified by the commit. For extremely large commits where GitHub is unable to calculate this list in a timely manner, this may be empty even if files were modified.

removed.description: An array of files removed in the commit. For extremely large commits where GitHub is unable to calculate this list in a timely manner, this may be empty even if files were removed.

custom-property-value.title: Custom Property Value
custom-property-value.description: Custom property name and associated value

value.description: The value assigned to the property

name.description: The unique package name within its ecosystem.

ecosystem.description: The package's language or package management ecosystem.

state.description: The state of the Dependabot alert.

manifest_path.description: The full path to the dependency manifest file, relative to the root of the repository.

scope.description: The execution scope of the vulnerable dependency.

security_advisory.description: Details for the GitHub Security Advisory.

ghsa_id.description: Details for the GitHub Security Advisory.

cve_id.description: The unique CVE ID assigned to the advisory.

summary.description: A short, plain text summary of the advisory.

description.description: A long-form Markdown-supported description of the advisory.

vulnerabilities.description: Vulnerable version range information for the advisory.

items.description: Details pertaining to one vulnerable version range for the advisory.

vulnerable_version_range.description: Conditions that identify vulnerable versions of this vulnerability's package.

first_patched_version.description: Details pertaining to the package version that patches this vulnerability.

identifier.description: The package version that patches this vulnerability.

cwes.description: Details for the advisory pertaining to Common Weakness Enumeration.

identifiers.description: Values that identify this advisory among security information sources.

value.description: The value of the advisory identifer.

url.description: The URL of the reference.

published_at.description: The time that the advisory was published in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

updated_at.description: The time that the advisory was last modified in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

withdrawn_at.description: The time that the advisory was withdrawn in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

security_vulnerability.description: Details pertaining to one vulnerable version range for the advisory.

vulnerable_version_range.description: Conditions that identify vulnerable versions of this vulnerability's package.

first_patched_version.description: Details pertaining to the package version that patches this vulnerability.

identifier.description: The package version that patches this vulnerability.

url.description: The REST API URL of the alert resource.

html_url.description: The GitHub URL of the alert resource.

created_at.description: The time that the alert was created in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

updated_at.description: The time that the alert was last updated in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

dismissed_at.description: The time that the alert was dismissed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

auto_dismissed_at.description: The time that the alert was auto-dismissed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

dismissed_reason.description: The reason that the alert was dismissed.

dismissed_comment.description: An optional comment associated with the alert's dismissal.

fixed_at.description: The time that the alert was no longer detected and was considered fixed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

ref.description: The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or sha.

task.description: Parameter to specify a task to execute

environment.description: Name of the target deployment environment.

transient_environment.description: Specifies if the given environment will no longer exist at some point in the future. Default: false.

production_environment.description: Specifies if the given environment is one that end-users directly interact with. Default: false.

repository_selection.description: Describe whether all repositories have been selected or there's a selection involved

target_id.description: The ID of the user or organization this token is being scoped to.

actions.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for GitHub Actions workflows, workflow runs, and artifacts.

administration.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for repository creation, deletion, settings, teams, and collaborators creation.

checks.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for checks on code.

contents.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for repository contents, commits, branches, downloads, releases, and merges.

deployments.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for deployments and deployment statuses.

environments.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for managing repository environments.

issues.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for issues and related comments, assignees, labels, and milestones.

members.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for organization teams and members.

metadata.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to search repositories, list collaborators, and access repository metadata.

organization_administration.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage access to an organization.

organization_hooks.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage the post-receive hooks for an organization.

organization_packages.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for organization packages published to GitHub Packages.

organization_plan.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for viewing an organization's plan.

organization_projects.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage organization projects and projects beta (where available).

organization_secrets.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage organization secrets.

organization_self_hosted_runners.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to view and manage GitHub Actions self-hosted runners available to an organization.

organization_user_blocking.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to view and manage users blocked by the organization.

packages.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for packages published to GitHub Packages.

pages.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to retrieve Pages statuses, configuration, and builds, as well as create new builds.

pull_requests.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for pull requests and related comments, assignees, labels, milestones, and merges.

repository_hooks.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage the post-receive hooks for a repository.

repository_projects.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage repository projects, columns, and cards.

secret_scanning_alerts.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to view and manage secret scanning alerts.

secrets.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage repository secrets.

security_events.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to view and manage security events like code scanning alerts.

single_file.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage just a single file.

statuses.description: The level of permission granted to the access token for commit statuses.

team_discussions.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage team discussions and related comments.

vulnerability_alerts.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to manage Dependabot alerts.

workflows.description: The level of permission granted to the access token to update GitHub Actions workflow files.

url.description: URL for the issue comment

id.description: Unique identifier of the issue comment

url.description: URL for the issue

number.description: Number uniquely identifying the issue within its repository

state.description: State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'

state_reason.description: The reason for the current state

url.description: URL for the label

color.description: 6-character hex code, without the leading #, identifying the color

membership.description: The membership between the user and the organization. Not present when the action is `member_invited`.

state.description: The state of the user's membership in the team.

role.description: The role of the user in the team.

membership.title: Membership

milestone.description: A collection of related issues and pull requests.

state.description: The state of the milestone.

milestone.title: Milestone

org-custom-property.title: Organization Custom Property
org-custom-property.description: Custom property defined on an organization

value_type.description: The type of the value for the property

allowed_values.description:
An ordered list of the allowed values of the property.
The property can have up to 200 allowed values.

values_editable_by.description: Who can edit the values of the property

archived.description: Whether or not the card is archived

id.description: The unique identifier of the project column

state.description: State of the project; either 'open' or 'closed'

projects_v2_item.description: The project item itself. To find more information about the project item, you can use `node_id` (the node ID of the project item) and `project_node_id` (the node ID of the project) to query information in the GraphQL API. For more information, see "[Using the API to manage projects](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/trying-out-the-new-projects-experience/using-the-api-to-manage-projects)."
projects_v2_item.title: Projects v2 Item

url.description: URL for the pull request review comment

pull_request_review_id.description: The ID of the pull request review to which the comment belongs.

id.description: The ID of the pull request review comment.

node_id.description: The node ID of the pull request review comment.

diff_hunk.description: The diff of the line that the comment refers to.

path.description: The relative path of the file to which the comment applies.

position.description: The line index in the diff to which the comment applies.

original_position.description: The index of the original line in the diff to which the comment applies.

commit_id.description: The SHA of the commit to which the comment applies.

original_commit_id.description: The SHA of the original commit to which the comment applies.

html_url.description: HTML URL for the pull request review comment.

pull_request_url.description: URL for the pull request that the review comment belongs to.

start_line.description: The first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

original_start_line.description: The first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

start_side.description: The side of the first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

original_line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

side.description: The side of the first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

in_reply_to_id.description: The comment ID to reply to.

subject_type.description: The level at which the comment is targeted, can be a diff line or a file.

commit_id.description: A commit SHA for the review.

number.description: Number uniquely identifying the pull request within its repository.

state.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

maintainer_can_modify.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

referenced-workflow.title: Referenced workflow
referenced-workflow.description: A workflow referenced/reused by the initial caller workflow

name.description: The file name of the asset.

state.description: State of the release asset.

target_commitish.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from.

draft.description: Whether the release is a draft or published

prerelease.description: Whether the release is identified as a prerelease or a full release.

archive_url.description: A template for the API URL to download the repository as an archive.

assignees_url.description: A template for the API URL to list the available assignees for issues in the repository.

blobs_url.description: A template for the API URL to create or retrieve a raw Git blob in the repository.

branches_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about branches in the repository.

collaborators_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about collaborators of the repository.

comments_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about comments on the repository.

commits_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about commits on the repository.

compare_url.description: A template for the API URL to compare two commits or refs.

contents_url.description: A template for the API URL to get the contents of the repository.

contributors_url.description: A template for the API URL to list the contributors to the repository.

deployments_url.description: The API URL to list the deployments of the repository.

downloads_url.description: The API URL to list the downloads on the repository.

events_url.description: The API URL to list the events of the repository.

fork.description: Whether the repository is a fork.

forks_url.description: The API URL to list the forks of the repository.

full_name.description: The full, globally unique, name of the repository.

git_commits_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about Git commits of the repository.

git_refs_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about Git refs of the repository.

git_tags_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about Git tags of the repository.

hooks_url.description: The API URL to list the hooks on the repository.

html_url.description: The URL to view the repository on GitHub.com.

issue_comment_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about issue comments on the repository.

issue_events_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about issue events on the repository.

issues_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about issues on the repository.

keys_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about deploy keys on the repository.

labels_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about labels of the repository.

languages_url.description: The API URL to get information about the languages of the repository.

merges_url.description: The API URL to merge branches in the repository.

milestones_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about milestones of the repository.

node_id.description: The GraphQL identifier of the repository.

notifications_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about notifications on the repository.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.

pulls_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about pull requests on the repository.

releases_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about releases on the repository.

stargazers_url.description: The API URL to list the stargazers on the repository.

statuses_url.description: A template for the API URL to get information about statuses of a commit.

subscribers_url.description: The API URL to list the subscribers on the repository.

subscription_url.description: The API URL to subscribe to notifications for this repository.

tags_url.description: The API URL to get information about tags on the repository.

teams_url.description: The API URL to list the teams on the repository.

trees_url.description: A template for the API URL to create or retrieve a raw Git tree of the repository.

url.description: The URL to get more information about the repository from the GitHub API.

disabled.description: Returns whether or not this repository is disabled.

default_branch.description: The default branch of the repository.

allow_squash_merge.description: Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.

allow_merge_commit.description: Whether to allow merge commits for pull requests.

allow_rebase_merge.description: Whether to allow rebase merges for pull requests.

allow_auto_merge.description: Whether to allow auto-merge for pull requests.

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Whether to delete head branches when pull requests are merged

created_at.description: The time that the alert was created in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

oneOf.description: The time that the alert was last updated in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

url.description: The REST API URL of the alert resource.

html_url.description: The GitHub URL of the alert resource.

locations_url.description: The REST API URL of the code locations for this alert.

resolution.description: **Required when the `state` is `resolved`.** The reason for resolving the alert.

resolved_at.description: The time that the alert was resolved in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

resolution_comment.description: An optional comment to resolve an alert.

secret_type.description: The type of secret that secret scanning detected.

secret_type_display_name.description:
User-friendly name for the detected secret, matching the `secret_type`.
For a list of built-in patterns, see "[Secret scanning patterns](https://docs.github.com/code-security/secret-scanning/secret-scanning-patterns#supported-secrets-for-advanced-security)."

push_protection_bypassed.description: Whether push protection was bypassed for the detected secret.

push_protection_bypassed_at.description: The time that push protection was bypassed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

type.description: The location type. Because secrets may be found in different types of resources (ie. code, comments, issues), this field identifies the type of resource where the secret was found.

details.description: Represents a 'commit' secret scanning location type. This location type shows that a secret was detected inside a commit to a repository.

path.description: The file path in the repository

start_line.description: Line number at which the secret starts in the file

end_line.description: Line number at which the secret ends in the file

start_column.description: The column at which the secret starts within the start line when the file is interpreted as 8BIT ASCII

end_column.description: The column at which the secret ends within the end line when the file is interpreted as 8BIT ASCII

blob_sha.description: SHA-1 hash ID of the associated blob

blob_url.description: The API URL to get the associated blob resource

commit_sha.description: SHA-1 hash ID of the associated commit

commit_url.description: The API URL to get the associated commit resource

details.title: Secret Scanning Location Commit

type.description: The location type. Because secrets may be found in different types of resources (ie. code, comments, issues), this field identifies the type of resource where the secret was found.

details.description: Represents an 'issue_title' secret scanning location type. This location type shows that a secret was detected in the title of an issue.

issue_title_url.description: The API URL to get the issue where the secret was detected.

details.title: Secret Scanning Location Issue Title

type.description: The location type. Because secrets may be found in different types of resources (ie. code, comments, issues), this field identifies the type of resource where the secret was found.

details.description: Represents an 'issue_body' secret scanning location type. This location type shows that a secret was detected in the body of an issue.

issue_body_url.description: The API URL to get the issue where the secret was detected.

details.title: Secret Scanning Location Issue Body

type.description: The location type. Because secrets may be found in different types of resources (ie. code, comments, issues), this field identifies the type of resource where the secret was found.

details.description: Represents an 'issue_comment' secret scanning location type. This location type shows that a secret was detected in a comment on an issue.

issue_comment_url.description: The API URL to get the issue comment where the secret was detected.

details.title: Secret Scanning Location Issue Comment

security-advisory-cvss.description: Details for the advisory pertaining to the Common Vulnerability Scoring System.

score.description: The overall CVSS score of the advisory.

vector_string.description: The full CVSS vector string for the advisory.

security-advisory-cvss.title: security_advisory cvss

security-advisory-cwes.description: A CWE weakness assigned to the advisory.

name.description: The short, plain text name of the CWE.

security-advisory-cwes.title: security_advisory cwes

sponsorship-tier.description: The `tier_changed` and `pending_tier_change` will include the original tier before the change or pending change. For more information, see the pending tier change payload.
sponsorship-tier.title: Sponsorship Tier

team.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

url.description: URL for the team

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories

url.description: URL for the team

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories

notification_setting.description: Whether team members will receive notifications when their team is @mentioned
Whether team members will receive notifications when their team is @mentioned

team.title: Team

workflow-job.description: The workflow job. Many `workflow_job` keys, such as `head_sha`, `conclusion`, and `started_at` are the same as those in a [`check_run`](#check_run) object.

status.description: The current status of the job. Can be `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

labels.description: Custom labels for the job. Specified by the [`"runs-on"` attribute](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/reference/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#jobsjob_idruns-on) in the workflow YAML.

runner_id.description: The ID of the runner that is running this job. This will be `null` as long as `workflow_job[status]` is `queued`.

runner_name.description: The name of the runner that is running this job. This will be `null` as long as `workflow_job[status]` is `queued`.

runner_group_id.description: The ID of the runner group that is running this job. This will be `null` as long as `workflow_job[status]` is `queued`.

runner_group_name.description: The name of the runner group that is running this job. This will be `null` as long as `workflow_job[status]` is `queued`.

head_branch.description: The name of the current branch.

workflow-job.title: Workflow Job

artifacts_url.description: The URL to the artifacts for the workflow run.

cancel_url.description: The URL to cancel the workflow run.

check_suite_url.description: The URL to the associated check suite.

check_suite_id.description: The ID of the associated check suite.

check_suite_node_id.description: The node ID of the associated check suite.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that points to the version of the workflow being run.

path.description: The full path of the workflow

id.description: The ID of the workflow run.

jobs_url.description: The URL to the jobs for the workflow run.

logs_url.description: The URL to download the logs for the workflow run.

name.description: The name of the workflow run.

rerun_url.description: The URL to rerun the workflow run.

run_number.description: The auto incrementing run number for the workflow run.

url.description: The URL to the workflow run.

workflow_id.description: The ID of the parent workflow.

run_attempt.description: Attempt number of the run, 1 for first attempt and higher if the workflow was re-run.

run_started_at.description: The start time of the latest run. Resets on re-run.

previous_attempt_url.description: The URL to the previous attempted run of this workflow, if one exists.
